Sh Fo

About

I am a PhD Candidate in English Literature at UCLA where I work on transhistorical questions across 17th-C literature, critical theory, and contemporary art. My dissertation traces a transhistorical "surface ethics" staged through the recurrence of what she is calling a Lucretian phenomenology of the inhuman: a drama that joins the likes of Margaret Cavendish and Thomas Browne with currents in the history of landscape painting, ecology, and land art.

Link to CV

Modeling the Line: Bresenham’s Algorithm, 1962–87, Architectural Theory Review

Out of Frame — Marcel Breuer's Atlanta Central Library, Architect's Newspaper
